abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment discusses
            at the same time environmental risks and mitigations covered
            in the Pilot Private Irrigation Promotion Project (see
            report no. 13939 SAR) as well as those examined in the
            expanded Private Irrigation Promotion Project. Only the
            usage of agrochemicals constitutes a major negative
            environmental impact, the impact on the health of farm
            families causing the principal concern. Other significant
            environmental issues for small-scale irrigation is the
            possibility for excessive water extraction from the
            construction of hand-held pumps, the cultivation of new land
            parcels (accompanied by deforestation and the soil
            deterioration), the draw-down of the water table, and the
            drainage of sediment and runoff and their concomitant effect
            on water quality. Measures to mitigate these negative
            impacts include: Developing an environmental assessment of
            each site and systematically monitoring it ; elaborating and
            incorporating environmental clauses in all legal documents
            and contracts relative to this project; putting in place a
            matching grant system enabling land valuation and
            environmental preservation; and researching technological
            options for aquifer use. Finally, an autonomous
            nongovernmental organization, the Nigerienne Association for
            Promoting Private Irrigation (ANPIP), will be charged with
            managing the project's environmental aspects.
